plan_name: Prose Cleanup - Fix AI Writing Patterns
description: Fix check_prose errors across the codebase to enable reliable prose checking without pre-existing issues
session_startup: Run git status to check branch
Run ./script/test in background to verify baseline
Read this file to find current task
Find first task where status=pending and blocked_by=null

approach.automatic_fixes: Fix egregious AI-isms automatically (delve, leverage, robust, seamless, synergy, paradigm, etc.)
approach.interactive_fixes: For borderline cases, show user the current text in context and proposed fix in context for approval
approach.exclusions: Skip LICENSE.md (legal text), context/ai-writing-patterns.md (reference doc listing the patterns)

tasks.name: Analyze and categorize all prose issues
steps: Run cargo xtask check-prose . --format json to get structured output
Categorize issues into: egregious (auto-fix), borderline (interactive), excluded (skip)
Create list of files to process, excluding LICENSE.md and ai-writing-patterns.md
acceptance_criteria: Have categorized list of all issues

tasks.name: Automatically fix egregious AI-isms
steps: Fix uses of: delve, leverage, harness, foster, elevate, streamline, illuminate, bolster
Fix uses of: robust, seamless, comprehensive, dynamic, actionable
Fix uses of: synergy, paradigm, framework (when not technical)
Fix uses of: Moreover, Additionally, Furthermore at sentence starts
Verify fixes don't break meaning or code

tasks.name: Interactively fix borderline cases
steps: For each borderline case, show user: file, line, current context (3-5 lines)
Show proposed fix in same context
Ask user to approve, modify, or skip
acceptance_criteria: User has reviewed all borderline cases

tasks.name: Verify and commit fixes
steps: Run cargo xtask check-prose . excluding LICENSE.md and ai-writing-patterns.md

notes: LICENSE.md is excluded because it's legal text we shouldn't modify
ai-writing-patterns.md is excluded because it lists the patterns as examples
Some technical terms like 'framework' or 'end-to-end' may be appropriate in context
Orchestrates is commonly used in this codebase for the phase pipeline - may keep
